profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-04-06 15:51:37 -0400.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Use of original papers requires an appointment and is limited to the Archives' Washington, D.C., Research Center. Microfilmed materials must be consulted on microfilm. Contact Reference Services for more information.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Scrapbook, photographs, correspondence, art work, estate papers, and printed material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: REEL 3960: Two copy prints of photographs of Koopman and his family, one dated May 1907 of Koopman, his wife Louise, and children Ellen and Bernard, the other undated of Koopman, enlarged from a snapshot.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: REEL 5321: Artwork, ca. 1892-1910 (43 items), including; a sketchbook; 23 loose sketches; 2 pastels; 15 prints; 2 watercolors; and 1 conte crayon drawing. Among the subjects are churches, infants, seascapes, and landscapes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: UNMICROFILMED: A scrapbook containing photographs of Koopman and his work, reproductions of his work, clippings, exhibition catalogues (some annotated) and a pastel; 18 monotypes; photographs of Koopman and his work; letters to Koopman and letters relating to the disposition of Koopman's estate (some are copies); notes; copy of Koopman's will; printed material, including exhibition catalogs, some annotated with prices; a "poster" signed by members of "Les Anciens d'Etaples" to be presented to Koopman while he was ill and ammended with his death date; a transcription of a newsclipping; and 8 copy prints of photographs of Koopman, Koopman in his studio, the Koopman family, and of a painting by Koopman of his mother.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: 35mm microfilm reels 3960 and 5321 available at Archives of American Art offices and through interlibrary loan.

originalsloc.head: Existence and Location of Originals
originalsloc.p: 10 photographs: Originals retained by the donor.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Painter; printmaker. b. Jan. 2, 1869, Charlotte, N.C.; d. Jan. 31, 1914, Etaples, France; attended Pennsylvania Academy of the Fine Arts.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The two photographs on reel 3960 were donated by Jane Koopman, Koopman's daughter-in-law, 1985. In 1994 Koopman's daughter, Mrs. T.M. (Ellen) Raysor, donated the scrapbook, letters, photos, monotypes, and other material,, and lent 8 photographs for copying. In 1998, a granddaughter, Cecily Hancock, lent a sketchbook and various artwork for microfilming (reel 5321).
